gameframework.assets

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameframework.assets.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    Class allowing to create sounds and play them. It is not intended to play musics. If you want to change the sound, you should create a new Sound object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sound(java.lang.String path)
      Creates and loads the sound

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isLooping() 
      boolean isPlaying()
      Determines if the sound is currently playing.
      void play()
      Plays the sound.
      void setLooping(boolean isLooping) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String path)
      throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
             java.io.IOException,
             javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Creates and loads the sound
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the sound asset
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException

    • Method Detail

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Determines if the sound is currently playing.
        Returns:
        true if the sound is playing, false otherwise

      • isLooping

        public boolean isLooping()
        Returns:
        true if the sound must loop, false otherwise

      • setLooping

        public void setLooping(boolean isLooping)
        Parameters:
        isLooping - true if the sound must loop, false otherwise

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the sound. If you play a sound that is already playing, it will start again from the beginning.
